intro: Vagnera stellata, commonly known as the star-leaved vagnera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to gardens. Vagnera stellata is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
